decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard. The deck includes many low-cost spells like Gut Shot and Lightning Bolt, as well as cantrips like Serum Visions and Faithless Looting to dig for key pieces. Thing in the Ice provides additional threats that can help to clear the board and protect the Phoenixes. The deck also includes disruption like Lightning Axe and Snapcaster Mage to handle opponent threats. The mana base includes fetch lands to enable Traverse the Ulvenwald and maximize the chances of casting the Phoenixes.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost, high-impact spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to efficiently remove threats and hit the opponent directly. By casting cheap spells like Gut Shot and Skewer the Critics, the deck aims to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard and attack for massive damage. With cards like Faithless Looting and Light Up the Stage providing card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on using cards that can lower your life total quickly to strengthen your Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. The goal is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while using removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with threats. Snapcaster Mage and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage while Temur Battle Rage can help you deliver lethal damage. Stubborn Denial offers protection for your creatures and can counter key spells. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and control the game with its disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo by ramping up mana quickly with cards like Ancient Stirrings, Explore, and Amulet of Vigor. It utilizes Summoner's Pact to search for key combo pieces like Primeval Titan and Tolaria West to tutor for utility lands like Ghost Quarter. The deck aims to cast Primeval Titan early to ramp up mana and get land combos online, such as gaining extra combat steps with Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion and Slayers' Stronghold. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm and overpower the opponent with a fast and potent combo.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays utilizing the Death's Shadow creature alongside cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler for additional threats while maintaining card advantage with cards like Serum Visions and Mishra's Bauble. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, while also having protection with cards like Stubborn Denial. Overall, the deck aims to pressure opponents quickly and efficiently with a combination of disruption and powerful threats.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam, while using cards like Narcomoeba and Bloodghast to bring creatures back from the graveyard and trigger effects like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam. The goal is to create a loop of dredging cards from the graveyard, generating card advantage and overwhelming your opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck aims to win the game by combining these graveyard interactions with efficient attacking and burn spells like Conflagrate.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, there are cards like Wurmcoil Engine and Walking Ballista to stabilize the board and win the game. The key idea is to ramp up mana production and deploy powerful threats to control the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by casting cheap and efficient burn spells like Skewer the Critics, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt. Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide are aggressive creatures that also help in dealing damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize, using cards like Searing Blaze and Eidolon of the Great Revel to control the board and push through damage. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, allowing the deck to execute its game plan quickly and effectively.

The main focus of this Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells and other cards, allowing for the revival of Arclight Phoenix. Utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Thought Scour, and Gut Shot, the deck aims to cast multiple instants and sorceries to trigger the Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. This strategy is supported by other aggressive creatures like Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice, along with burn spells and card draw to maintain pressure on opponents and overwhelm them with fast, efficient plays.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity Modern deck is to swarm the board with artifact creatures and gain a tempo advantage by equipping Cranial Plating to boost their power and toughness. The deck utilizes efficient mana sources like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to quickly deploy threats like Vault Skirge, Etched Champion, and Arcbound Ravager. Steel Overseer can further buff up the team while Welding Jar provides protection. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with aggressive attacks and burn spells like Galvanic Blast.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually pulling ahead with card advantage and powerful planeswalker threats like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command to adapt to various situations. The mana base is carefully crafted to support casting multiple color spells and to ensure consistency in hitting land drops.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource by discarding cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting to quickly fill it up with cards such as Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam. By dredging cards from the graveyard, the deck aims to bring back creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba while dealing damage with Conflagrate. The deck uses cards like Shriekhorn and Cathartic Reunion to facilitate the dredge process, with the overall goal of overwhelming the opponent with a fast and resilient combo.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively fill up the graveyard with spells and then utilize cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The deck also includes other threats like Thing in the Ice, Crackling Drake, and Young Pyromancer to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck's instant and sorcery-heavy nature allows for quick and explosive plays, while also providing card draw and manipulation to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main goal of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource by quickly filling it with cards through dredge mechanics. By milling cards from the library using cards like Shriekhorn and Stinkweed Imp, the deck aims to bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard to the battlefield. Creeping Chill provides direct damage to the opponent while Life from the Loam allows for consistent land recursion. The deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and direct damage spells like Conflagrate.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck and win the game with Laboratory Maniac. It utilizes various mana acceleration tools like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to cast Ad Nauseam as early as possible. Phyrexian Unlife helps to survive the high life loss from Ad Nauseam, with Pact of Negation providing protection. Spoils of the Vault can be used to search for combo pieces, while Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help with card selection. The deck aims to win the game in one explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive Human creatures while utilizing Aether Vial to cheat them into play and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient creature-based strategy, utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team and cards like Noble Hierarch to ramp into bigger threats. The deck also utilizes a mana base focused on producing all the necessary colors to cast its diverse array of Humans.
